item.title: I am dying of squamous cell carcinoma, & potential treatments are out of reach
item.description: - The author is suffering from squamous cell carcinoma and is running out of treatment options.

item.title: A Caltech Nobel laureate celebrates his 100th birthday, then gets back to work
item.description: - Caltech chemistry professor Rudy Marcus celebrated his 100th birthday with a symposium in his honor, showcasing his long career and contributions to science.

item.title: Plane â€“ Open-source Jira alternative
item.description: - Plane is an open-source software development tool that helps manage issues, sprints, and product roadmaps in an easy and customizable way.

item.title: Shopify employee breaks NDA to reveal firm replacing laid off workers with AI
item.description: - A Shopify employee has broken their non-disclosure agreement to reveal that the company is replacing laid-off workers with AI and cheaper contract labor.

item.title: FBI improperly used 702 surveillance powers on US senator
item.description: - The FBI was found to have improperly used surveillance powers under Section 702 of the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act to search for information on a US senator, a state lawmaker, and a state judge.

item.title: Putting the "You" in CPU
item.description: - This article explains what happens when you run a program on your computer, including multiprocessing, system calls, memory management, and executable loading.

item.title: Egregoria: 3D City Builder without a grid
item.description: - Egregoria is an indie city builder game inspired by Cities:Skylines, focused on the socio-economical aspect of a city with a logistics element.

item.title: Important Coding Habits
item.description: - It is essential to develop good coding habits to avoid physical complications such as slipped discs caused by long hours of sitting and poor posture.

item.title: AWS networking concepts in a diagram
item.description: - The author struggled to understand the AWS VPC dashboard until they read a book on AWS Networking Fundamentals.

item.title: Compromised Microsoft key: More impactful than we thought
item.description: - Microsoft and CISA have disclosed a security incident where a threat actor from China acquired a private encryption key (MSA key) and used it to forge access tokens, impacting multiple customers of Exchange Online and Outlook.com.
